intro: Synthyris missurica, commonly known as the Missourian synthyris, is a flowering plant native to the central United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. It is an herbaceous perennial that produces small, angular fruits known as schizocarps. Synthyris missurica is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
